text: Did you ever read "the lady, or the tiger?"
There's a Princess who falls in love with a guard,
So when her father, the king, finds out,
he throws the guard into some kind of arena.
Behind one door is a tiger
And behind the other is a lady
with whom he'd be free to live the rest of his life.
Forced to sit in the stands
What do you think she chose?
I thought I should check when Zach mentioned
He's down the hall, talking to Dr. Wallace.
Jodi forgets the question while she's answering it.
But she does remember events and people
prior to the car accident, though, right?
Uh, but she can't form new memories.
she bears no resemblance to the woman I married.
I am Dr. Montgomery, your ob-gyn,
and I'm taking care of you and your baby.
Oh, Zach and I, we've been trying for so long.
I wish we knew Jodi was pregnant before the accident
so at least she could remember that.
What helps you get through it?
When I tell her the story of how we first met...
And for a moment, it's like she's still in there.
Almost nine months ago, but you keep forgetting
because you had a car accident eight months ago,
That Jodi had just died in the accident.
How do we have a kid?
I-I don't even really... Remember you.
We were hammered, and it was nine years ago.
I mean, you're sure, he's--he's, uh--
I-I mean, maybe it could've been-- you might want to rethink
calling the mother of your child a whore.
No, that's not what I meant. Okay?
I can't just distract him and hope he forgets.
I just wish you had called me
when you found out you were pregnant.
Why, so you could tell me to take care of it?
Uh, because I wish I had known sooner.
Want to start with a checkup and go from there?
I'm saying, do you want to meet your son?
And I am not here to babysit you.
Sheldon is taking over my patients,
and I just need to update their charts, so--
you can't do that from home? Why would I do that from home?
Because you don't happen to work here at the moment.
Pete, I get that you're angry. I understand that that's
a necessary phase-- oh, do not tell me how I feel.
but we now know she's gonna have a boy.
Dr. Turner, nice to see you.
How are Jodi and the baby?
They're both on track for the c-section next week.
Honey, you're-- you're having a baby.
Okay, do you remember the first time we met?
You came in with all your friends.
Yeah, that's the way you smile.
Zach, you'll call, and we'll finish our conversation
about how she'll handle the baby and breast-feeding.
Uh, Dr. Turner, would you take Jodi to the lobby, please?
I'm taking the baby, and we're leaving her.
Did you tell Zach to leave Jodi?
Jodi is eight and a half months pregnant, with the worst case
of anterograde amnesia I've ever seen,
and Zach is her ass of husband
who is waiting for her to give birth
so he can take the baby and leave.
What did you say to my patient?
Wait. You asked Sheldon to cover your cases.
Doesn't that make Zach his patient?
I'm helping him come to terms with it.
but it is kind of like living with a parrot.
So she's supposed to just carry the baby, deliver it,
and then he just gets to take the kid and go?
Jodi won't even remember it's her kid.
That's not gonna matter to the kid.
A child needs a mother to bond to.
Yeah, but they don't need to be traumatized.
What about what a wife needs?
I mean, Zach can't just abandon her.
He's--he's just angry. Just a phase.
She's all alone. He has an obligation. He married her.
I love you, Addie, but you're not really gonna
preach about the sanctity of marriage, are you?
What if she had cancer? You think he'd walk out then?
This is different. Cancer is often a death sentence.
Zach is living life without parole.
And there's a third life to consider here.
Sheldon, in many, many months of talking to Zach,
he never once said that he wanted to leave.
But now suddenly, talking to you--
I'm certain Zach contemplated leaving long before today.
And I imagine he actually would've told you
if you hadn't confused your own convictions
Maybe he's in an angry phase, too.
I realize I can't compete with seadra.
You read it off the card.
Yeah, see? Stick out your tongue.
It is when the doctor asks.
So if the doctor asks me to say "crap"--
I'm just gonna take a little blood.
You should check your pocket, man.
I mean, there's your bedding, and there's my bedding,
but I thought it would be nice
Uh, our sheets are ratty, and there was a sale.
But I-I tried to be romantic.
Yes, i-i... But then you had to come in...
Called you on it. And call me on it.
And that was uncool, so just choose.
Can't you be a little bit more enthusiastic about it?
I'm sorry. I just-- would you leave me
the minute I have a baby if I had a brain injury?
What--what-- what's wrong with your brain?
No, not my brain. My patient's brain.
Wait. Did you just ask me if I was gonna leave you
No, Sam. I'm not talking about us.
By the way, I'm not even pregnant, so...
Whatever. You know, I wasn't talking about us, so...
Are you--are you worried, uh, that I'm gonna leave you--
Okay, I am gonna tell you something
that has the potential to make you angry.
I mean, I understand why it could,
but it--it could also be great, amazing.
And I realize it's gonna change things-- just say it already.
and we were together nine years ago.
And it was-- it was one night, and--
Uh, her name is Erica Warner.
Y-You were only together one night,
and you trust this Erica because...
The minute I saw him, I knew.
Did you take a paternity test?
tells you you're the father of her 8-year-old child,
and you just take her word for it?
Hey, I was just coming to talk to you.
And somehow I anticipated that and decided to leave.
that I cannot be impartial with my patients.
I am sorry. That was rude of me.
why don't we discuss the public implication
that I would assert to my patient
what he should or shouldn't do with regard to his marriage?
Did you even entertain the idea
that Zach could talk to you about leaving Jodi
because it's easier for him to talk to a man?
Violet, I don't want to discuss this with you.
But I knew Zach and Jodi before.
They--they came to me for infertility,
which, as you know, can destroy a couple.
But they never blamed one another,
the never gave up on one another.
They were really, truly in love.
And you never got to see that.
I read your notes, Violet, your very sparse notes.
So that's all I had to go on.
Well, that's helpful. Late, but helpful. So thank you.
Well, how the hell was I supposed to know
you were gonna take over my patients?
You just gotta keep on walking, Sheldon.
I'm saying, she's like a dog with a bone.
She won't stop, so at some point,
you just gotta keep on walking.
It's a necessary phase. He'll move through it.
It can't be easy, being the target, though.
Zach's feelings are-- are cyclical, Sheldon.
He does not want to leave.
As long as your license is suspended,
a woman shows up out of nowhere
and tells a guy that he's got an 8-year-old son.
what risk does her brain injury pose?
Mm. Fluid may build up during delivery,
increasing the pressure in her brain.
If you're asking, I should be in there with you.
Sam texted me. Mine's from Sheldon.
Oh, my god. Did you hear?
Oh, Cooper's gonna be a great dad.
That is a stupid thing to say.
that he wanted to meet his, uh... me.
I'm supposed to believe he's the only one she slept with?
She probably just looked up the guy she screwed,
saw that Cooper was a doctor, and bingo--names him daddy.
Would it really kill you to be its other mommy?
Everybody just slow the hell down.
We don't even really know if this is Cooper's child.
Oh, I know, but, you guys, this kid--
he's got my hair, he's got my eyes,
he's got my sense of humor.
It's-- you really think she'd lie to him?
We did it once, nine years ago, back of her car.
Uh, I know it's none of my business, but...
There's this kid that you wish would disappear,
and that makes you feel guilty,
and worse, he could end up being a part of your life
and you didn't ask for him.
You do have a choice, you know?
♪ is it really that much sweeter ♪
You do not have to worry about me.
and if you--if you took the paternity test,
So why don't you just take it?
And... for the first time in my life,
I look at Mason, I see...
I look at Mason, I see my biological son.
I mean, I have an amazing family.
You need to think he's yours just a little while longer
♪ Someone who makes two become one ♪
And I know it's only been three days--
almost three days-- but it's three days sober,
You're keeping a secret, aren't you?
but just once, you need to let it out, don't you?
Well, you better hurry before Pete does it.
and--and telling me how to treat Zach
and--and prodding me for details of the case.
Well, have you told her to back off? Yes.
And did she back off? Yeah.
Oh, shut up. No, I mean, you're a surgeon?
People let you cut them open?
Oh, don't look at me like that.
for trying to compartmentalize having a baby
N-No. I wanted to talk about Zach and Jodi.
So Zach is making a mistake,
and I would tell him that
if the law didn't prohibit me from speaking to him,
and Sheldon's not gonna tell him that he's doing anything wrong.
I used to make fun of Jodi and her lists.
there was a pad in every room.
Being here for her, loving her--
Is there any way you don't have to leave completely?
I didn't sign up for this.
Yeah, but isn't that the point?
We sign up, we never know
what we're gonna get, but you...
You stay, you stick it out.
You want to know what staying looks like?
Y-You can't. I-I can't live without you.
My baby... This is what it's like,
But I'm taking the baby and I'm leaving you.
I-I hate who I've become, because living like this
My wife has become my child.
I want our kid to have a normal life,
and how is that possible with Jodi...
I can't take care of them both.
Inside of there is the woman that you love.
I mean, you have to stop. You're hurting her.
Jodi, you're okay. Everything's gonna be okay.
I'm Dr. Montgomery, and you're having a baby.
What the hell is happening to me?
You're having a baby, Jodi. You don't remember
because you were in an accident.
I need Zach. Dr. Turner, where is my husband?
Zach will be here very soon.
It hurts. Why does it hurt?
That's Dr. Montgomery. She's gonna deliver your baby.
Jodi, I need you to push.
Her heart rate's dropping. It's a cushion reflex.
It's a sign that there's a critical rise in her I.C.P.
He came to the hospital. I haven't seen him since.
Yes, I tried. But he's made up his mind.
I'm sure he was trying to do the right thing. Okay, you know what?
I am legally blocked from talking to Zach,
but you can talk to him again.
And--and the great thing about you not being a therapist is,
you can say whatever the hell you want.
You--you can yell at him, you can shame him,
you--you can--you can say e-every messed up thing
that you ever wanted to say to any guy who abandoned you
or didn't show up for you, but get him back in here,
because his wife needs him, now.
Can you breathe? Can you look at me? I can't. I can't.
So, um, he doesn't know who you are,
and I'm not ready for him to know,
I get junk food 'cause I let you take my blood.
Well, you didn't really let me, but okay.
So what are you doing here?
See, mom, he eats it and he's a doctor.
Yeah, I'm sure he doesn't do it often.
No, no, your mom's right. It's not good for you.
And I-I don't come here all the time.
don't tell my other patients, okay?
So what flavors did you get?
Oh, I got vanilla, chocolate, and strawberry.
You know how I dip my fries in my shake,
Mason dipped his fry, same way, except here's the thing--
I bought all three major flavors.
And do you know which one he picked?
What kid doesn't pick chocolate or vanilla?!
I mean, he's so my kid.
I'm gonna go to the toy store later.
Erica said Mason doesn't have a lot of toys.
They have a lot of money, really.
What the hell are you doing out here?
Jodi's in labor. She's scared and confused.
You think you have to tell me that?
The baby is coming now, Zach.
And Jodi, the unlucky one who suffered the brain injury
and has carried your child for the last nine months,
And she's not gonna understand, Zach, why it feels like
her insides are being torn apart.
even more petrified and confused and alone.
You'll be there, and Dr. Turner will be there.
The whole hospital could be there, and she'd still be alone,
because there's only one person who can make her not feel alone.
There's only one person who can calm her down, and that is you.
So if you ever loved Jodi,
be the man you promised her to be.
All right, and then-- then you can go.
What do you want to know?
Well, you can start by explaining
why you didn't tell Cooper about Mason.
I was young. I liked to party.
I was tending bar, and we did it in my car.
I know that sounds bad, but--
you think Cooper was my first?
Well, a month or so later, I realized I was pregnant.
Well, somehow getting knocked up's always a woman's fault.
And if I did call, and he wasn't that guy,
then we would've been stuck in each other's lives, and...
20 grand should go a long way.
You run out, let me know.
Stay the hell away from us.
♪ You got to get it, baby ♪
♪ yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah ♪
♪ can't you see you're only chasing? ♪
It's been 20 years, you still got that weak-ass d.
Talk all the trash you want. I'm still up.
♪ well, if you wanna keep up ♪
♪ you got to move a little faster ♪
Loser buys. Oh, you feelin' flush?
Huh? You feelin' flush? Come on.
Let me ask you something. What can you tell me about women
I'm up to my ass in ovaries all day long,
and you're asking me about I.V.F. Here?
Well, it depends on the woman, you know, but, uh,
it can be pretty brutal on 'em.
What are we talking, p.M.S. Crazy or worse?
And, you know, it's hard to watch the woman you love
Especially if you're not the one who wants a child.
♪ If you wanna keep up, you got to move a little faster ♪
You know, usually I tell the dads that, uh,
it's worth it once the baby comes.
That's not gonna help here, huh?
♪ You're too slow, boy, if you wanna keep up ♪
♪ you got to move a little faster ♪
Erica's bringing Mason by. I thought--
And not just with me and Mason,
Do you think I should call or is that...
The woman never told you she was pregnant,
and then shows up after almost a decade.
What would make you think she's consistent or reliable?
And I don't want you to get hurt.
Jodi, Jodi, I need you to stay calm, okay?
For you and for the baby.
Zach, I need her to push now.
You need to push. You can do this.
I-I can't. I can't. It hurts. It hurts, Zach.
Please. Okay, hey, I remember walking over to the table
and being annoyed that it wasn't even my section,
but I came over, and the only face I saw was yours.
Look into my eyes. Look at me.
And I was trying to write down all the orders,
but my hands, they were shaking so much.
And I knew then at that exact moment
that I was totally and completely in love with you.
But I was too scared to ask you out.
And so you came into the restaurant
and you sat in my section.
And on the busiest night of the year, 300 reservations...
Zach, I need her to push.
Okay, Jodi, honey, we are having a baby.
Dr. Montgomery, we need to give her the baby right away,
All right? We're having a baby.
In a few seconds, you're gonna hold our baby.
You can do this. Do it for me. Okay?
the more I think about my relationship with Violet,
the more I wonder if it was ever good.
Well, as someone who competed with you
I can say with certainty that this is revisionist history.
Right, but she can't stop shrinking me.
She can't stop telling me what phase I'm in.
Well, those are just her defense mechanisms.
She has every reason to be a little defensive
What are you doing here? Uh, Jodi went into labor.
She needed a familiar face around.
I-I held her hand. That's all.
You're on a very thin line, Violet.
Yes. Well, since you encouraged her husband to leave her,
she needed me on that thin line.
But she's not your patient, Violet.
So you really have no business--
no, you have no business, okay?
You're not in this argument right now.
You are not a therapist, so you don't get an opinion.
And if you did need to have one,
then why don't you take my side?
Violet, I'm just saying-- you are my husband, Pete.
For one damn minute, be my husband and take my side.
Who's in the anger phase now?
He's not just angry. It's like...
I don't feel like it's safe to breathe.
What are you saying to him?
I care about you, Violet. I'm trying to help you.
I think it was good that you held Jodi's hand.
Hey. I was starting to think you bailed.
Well, I understand that you're trying to protect Mason,
I-I think I deserve a chance.
Yeah, I thought you deserved a chance, too,
Do you know what I could do for Mason with that?
I could get a car, a better place.
You can't buy me off, Cooper.
And the fact that you sent your wife to do your dirty work
so that you could be the good guy-- stop. No.
I had nothing to do with this. You have to believe me.
And I promise you, I will never hurt Mason,
♪ When church bells make no sound ♪
You want to know why I couldn't come in here
Because I knew that as soon as labor started,
it would end, and when it was over,
I'd have to take the baby and go.
I just don't know. I love her.
Now I'm beginning to think I wasn't...
And I just needed a happy ending.
I thought it'd be easier to leave after he came.
Jodi and I, we made him.
Now I get to introduce my son to his mom.
And I get to introduce Jodi to our boy.
Of course, I'll have to keep doing it,
So what are you gonna do?
♪ on how we should have lived ♪
I'll stay until I can't anymore.
What the hell is wrong with you?
One of us had to be an adult here,
and you couldn't, so I had to be. Uh-huh.
Because she knew you'd be ready
to give her everything without taking the test.
Are you jealous that Erica gave me something that you won't?
Is that why you're trying to ruin this for me?
Yeah, Charlotte, you married an idiot--
a man who's excited about the idea of being a father,
a man who loves kids more than anything,
but who loved you enough to wait, to put it off.
And since the lines have already been blurred,
You're being an ass to Violet.
You say your problem is, she won't stop shrinking you,
but when does she stop, when she finally breaks,
Great. So now you're on her side.
It's about you getting that you're going to burn down
the one thing you say you care about.
You're burning down Lucas' happy home.
I don't know how to stop.
I feel like I hate her.
You have a lot of rage.
And she's right that this is a necessary phase.
But you have to find a new place to direct it.
but she's not your enemy and she's not your mother,
and if you drive her away, if you--
if you break Lucas' home, you...
You're at a precipice, and if you go over,
I don't know if you'd ever make it back.
And you need to get a therapist.
You don't want to hear from me anymore, huh?
I do want to hear from you,
but I want to be able to talk back to you like this,
because you're gonna need one of those, too.
Go home to your wife, Pete.
Make yourself remember the things you love about her.
I want to ask you something
I have other friends that are men,
you know, but I just feel like,
given what you do, you could give me a...
but also understand the female part of it, too.
Do you want to just ask me the question?
I want to say things to you
that I haven't even said to Sam,
and that feels a little weird
I-I don't know anything about you.
Well, if it makes it any easier,
you can-- you can ask me anything.
Or I can just tell you.
I am the oldest of four, three sisters.
Father left when I was 9. Mother died when I was 18.
because I didn't want to split up my family.
So I worked three jobs-- bike courier, bellman,
At one point, I even sold my sperm.
but I did what I had to do.
I had a free ride to college, put myself through med school.
There have been a lot of women.
But I've really only been in love once.
Is Sam gonna leave me if I go crazy on hormones?
Look, I can tell you what it's like for a man
on the other end of that,
I can also tell you what it's like for a woman.
But what you're asking me is, how is Sam going to take it?
Here's what I know about Sam.
got a pretty decent jump shot,
And he's always seemed like a stand-up guy to me.
your instinct is probably going to be a better guide
Well... I'm gonna go to bed.
so I took your toothbrush to my lab.
♪ time is the string in between ♪
I'm worried you'll leave me if I have a baby.
I thought the Princess chose the tiger
because who would want to watch the man you love
spend the rest of his life with another woman?
I mean, honestly, I've been there,
I guess I'd like to think that...
To think that love might mean...
Wanting the other person to be happy,
even if that means they can't stay with you.
